i Offensive Weapons Act, No. 18 of 1966
AN ACT TO PROVIDE FOR THE PROHIBITION OF THE
IMPORTATION, MANUFACTURB, POSSESSION, SALB,
EXPOSURE FOR SALE, ACQUISITION, TRANSPORT,
, USE OR SUPPLY OF, AND OF THE DOING OF
(CERTAIN OTHER ACTS OR THINGS WITH, OFFENSIVE
WEAPONS.
[Date of Assent: June 21, 1966]
BE it enacted by the Queen's Most Excellent
Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of
the Senate and the House of Representatives of
Ceylon in this present Parliament assembled, and
by the authority of the same, as follows :
1. This Act may be cited as the Offensive stort tie
Weapons Act, No. 18 of 1966.
2. (1) Any person sho, except with, lawful moanitos of
authority the proof whereof shall lie on him, {8 imporatoo,
@ imports or offers to import any offensive "*P
weapon into Ceylon ; oF
* (@ manufactures, possesses, sells, exposes for
sale, supplies, acquires, transports or uses,
for any purpose or in any manner '
whatsoever any offensive weapon ; or
() offers to do any act or thing referred to in :
paragraph os of this sub-section, '
shall be guilty of an offence under this Act punish-
able with imprisonment of either description fora -
term not exceeding fen years, and also with a fine
hot exceeding ten thousand rupees, and may in
addition be punished with whipping.
(2) For the purposes of this section, any offensive :
weapon in the control, power or disposition of any i
person shall be deemed to be in his possession.
@) For the parposes of this section, the ex-
pression, lawful authority ", in relation to any
act or thing referred to in sub-section (1) whi
is done or offered to be done by any person -in
respect of any offensive weapon, means
(@ any such act or thing so done or offered to
be done by him in his capacity as a
member of the Ceylon Army, the Roval

in the course or for the purposes of his
. duties as such member ; or
( any such act or thing so done or offered to *

with
@ the provisions of the Explosives Ordi-
mance or any other written law, or
Gi) the authority of any instrument by
whatsoever name or designation
called duly issued or granted to
him under such provisions,
amags, 3. Any person who does with any offensive
bya of weapon any act or thing
waren (@ which causes, whether directly or indirectly,
damage or destruction to any movable
or immovable property of the Crown,
any body of persons whether corporate oF
lunincorporate, or any individual ; or
( which causes, whether directly or indirectly,
- any such change in such property a8
destroys its value or utility,
shall be guilty of an offence under this Act
punishable with imprisonment of either description
for a term not exceeding twenty years, and also
with a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees, and
may in addition be punished with whipping,
Atte 4. (1) Any person
auheat @ who attempts to cause the death of any other
Geo person with any offensive weapon but does
fepous, not cause injury to such other person, or
() who attempts to cause injury to any other
person with an offensive weapon,
shall be guilty of an offence under this Act punish-
able with imprisonment of either description for a
term not exceeding ten years, and also with a fine ,
not exceeding ten thousand rupees, and may in
addition be punished with whipping.
Offensive Weapons Act, No. 18 of 1966 3
(2) Any person who causes injury to any other
person with any offensive weapon shall be guilty
of an offence under this Act punishable with :
imprisonment of either description for a term
which shall not be less than ten years and not more
than twenty Pi and also with a fine not
exceeding ten thousand rupees,
5. Any n who attempts to commit any Atemptsto
offence under this Act, other than any such offence Sgmicheas
under section 4(1), shall also be guilty of that
offence, and accoraingly shall be punished with the
penalty provided for that offence by this Act
6 (1) Any person who somes
@ instigates any other person to commit an *
offence under this Act 3 or
(0) engages in any conspiracy for the commission
of that offence ; or
intentionally aids, by any act, or illegal
omission, the commission of that offence,
+ Shall also be guilty of that offence, and accordingly
* shall be punished with the penalty provided for
that offence by this Act.
(2) The provisions of the Penal Code relating to
the abetment of an offence shall not apply to the
abetment of an offence under this Act.
7. (1) Any police officer. may, without any Pover of
order or warrant from a Magistrate, Be whut
@ arrest any person who has in his possession **
any offensive weapon if such officer has
reasonable cause to believe that such
person is committing, or is about to
commit, an offence under this Act ; and
remove such: weapon from the possession
of such person,
QA police officer wo removes any offensive

.. Sb-section (may take all such steps as such

harmless, y
4 Offensive Weapons Act, No. 18 of 1966
Pore ee seach 8. (1) Where a police officer of @ rank not
Premises, below that of Sub-Inspector has reasonable cause
to believe that an offence under this Act bas been,
or is about to be, or is being, committed and that
evidence of the commission of such offence is
to be found on sny premises or in any vehicle or
vessel, such officer may, with such assistance as
may be required, enter such premises or, as the
case may be, the premises on which the vehicle
or vessel may be, and search such premises or,
as the case may be, the vehicle or vessel.
(2) Any police officer scarching any premises,
or any vehicle or vessel, under sub-section (1) and
every person assisting such officer may search
any person who is found in, or whom he has
reasonable cause to believe to have recently left,
or to be about to enter such premises or such
\ vehicle or vessel, as the case may be, and may
| seize any article, found in such premises or in
such vehicle or vessel, which he has reasonable
} cause to believe to be evidence of the commission .
of au offence under this Act. Any article so
seized which is an offensive weapon may be
immiediately rendered harmless by such officer
or other person assisting such officer.
(3) Such police officer shall, within forty-eight
hours of such search, make a report to the nearest
Magistrates Court stating the circumstances and
the manner in which such search was made and
the result thereof.

@) The following provisions shall apply in any 1
case where the Attorney-General indicts a person
before a District Court under sub-section ie |
@ An indictment prepared in the manner pres- 1
cribed by section 186 of the Criminal '
Procedure Code shall be transmitted by |
the Attomey General to the District H
Court. _ He shall at the same time transmit |
to the Fiscal of the province in which the I

the indictment for service on the accused |
person or each of the accused persons |
who will be tried upon the indictment,
The Fiscal shall forthwith and at Jeast
fourteen days before the day specitied
for trial serve or cause to be served on the
accused person or each of the accused
persons, the copy or a copy of the indict
nent received by him from the Attorney-
General and shall make a return of such

Attorney-General or any officer appointed
by the Attorney-General to represent
im.
The District Court shall forthwith upon
the receipt of the indictment cause to be
served on the accused person a notice
Specifying the date fixed For his trial.
( Service on an accused person of any indict.
ment or aotice of rial shall be effected
in the manner prescribed for the service
of summons in sections 45 and 46 of

Provided, however, that if sexvice

ment or notice shall be affixed to some
conspicuous part of the house in which
the accused person ordinarily resides, and
in such case the indictment or notico
: shall be deemed to have been duly served.

tial, cause to be furnished to that person

wrens te offence under this Act shall be taken up before any
Epos sees other business of that Court unless special cir
i Ae, cumstances of urgency in such other business render

Forfeiture of Ta A Court may, on conviction of any
Pittay person for an offence under this Act, make order
that any article (including any offensive weapon
or any ship or boat or other vessel or any vehicle)
in connection with which the offence was committed
or which was used in or in connection with the -
commission of the offence, shall be forfeited to
the Crown.

(2) Any article forfeited to the Crown under
any order made by any Court under sub-setion (1)
which is an offensive weapon shall be sent by
Court to the Commander of the Ceylon Army for
disposal in such manner as he may deem fit,
15. (1) The following provisions shall apply Evidemoof
in any case where In any proceedings before a Ste
Court for an offence under this Act it has to be
determined whether any article is an offensive
weapon
@ A certificate under the hand of the Govera-
ment Analyst or a Deputy Government

an offensive weapon shall be teceived ia
such proceedings as evidence of the fact
